text: I then practiced medicine in Humahuaca. One afternoon, a boy fell down a hill; he had fallen off a cliff. When I took off the raincoat to check it, I saw two wings. I examined them: they were healthy. When the child could speak, I asked him, “Why didn’t you cry, my child, when you felt yourself falling? - Flying? - he said - Fly, so people laugh at me? FIN
title: Alas
author: Enrique Anderson Imbert
